intro: Carphalea somaliensis, commonly known as Somali carphalea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia and neighboring countries. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can tolerate high temperatures and limited water availability. Carphalea somaliensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
